intro: Sarcotoechia serrata, commonly known as the serrated sarcotoechia, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, serrated leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are small berries that contain seeds, typical of many species in the Rubiaceae family. Sarcotoechia serrata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest undergrowth.
